column4: do you know what can be the cause for grub to not being installed after a 8.10 installation?
In my case, the reason was that the installer crashed when it tried to install it. >_>
i think my installation didnt crash
Grub still gone? Or did you get it back?
(There's also an "advanced" option that allows you to choose whether you want to install Grub or not. It's checked by default though, so you probably didn't change it.)
still gone
Then reinstall manually. =)
i tried chroot
i cannot access my ubuntu installation
When using the chroot way to install grub, it's important that both Linuxes use the same architecture (e.g. x86 or x64)
they do, but i got an error with the BIOS driver for /dev/sda or something
Can you paste that?
nop, i didnt write it down
Can't help you much without any idea what went wrong. :D
Are you familiar with manually mounting partitions?
i am trying to find the error in google
yes, i know how to mount partitions
Are you on a RAID of some kind?
nop
Sorry, no clues then. Your system probably can't find it, no idea for what reason though. Try rebooting and watching the messages/reading the logs so you find out what causes it.
thanks, i'll try
